I'm sorry, but what's the science between the chemicals of non organic towels going into the bloodstream, because I'm sceptical about that. It's still good to have natural materials, and I also believe natural fabrics can be good for your skin especially if you have sensitive skin and get irritated skin fast.

@Alexandra To me, it makes sense as much as it does about the food we put in our bodies. We can't escape all the chemicals and harmful things in this world, so in areas where we can do better, I believe we should. There are so many chemicals in household items, beauty products, clothing, etc that don't need to be.

@Kristen & Siya I must say I looked it up there's definitely not been enough research about it, all research is from bias companies that sell organic things or really small research, with almost no testing so not really liable. It's interesting, so I hope they'll do larger scale more liable research. Definitely think it's good to buy organic things from a environmental point of view. I do believe that to some extent it can get in your skin but I don't believe so much gets in your skin that it becomes bad for your health or dangerous (I'm talking here about the fabrics that are allowed to be sold in the EU, with the health regulations) But that's just what I believe in.
Feel free to look it up to learn more.
